text: [Music]
hi I'm Jesse Griffiths we're at I do a
butcher shop at supper club in Austin
Texas and we are going to break a
chicken down into serving pieces I'm
gonna break it down into eight two
pieces to this way of breaking down a
chicken is really good for braising but
it's especially good for frying because
it makes all the pieces of pretty
consistent in their thickness and we're
able to do the whole chicken pretty
quickly all at one time and it comes out
really nice so what I do is I lay the
chicken on one side would come in with
my knife I'm just going to follow that
all the way down to the first joint then
expose that bone bone then I come in I'm
going to break that out and it'll just
kind of peel off from there and then I'm
going to come back with my knife and I'm
gonna cut on this side down almost to
the back leg and what I've done is I've
taken off this really nice piece of meat
right here this is my favorite part of
the fried chicken the next step I'm
going to come in then I'm going to take
these leg quarters off just simply
separating out the skin here and then I
want to come in and free up what's
called the oyster let me use the tip of
my knife to get in there as much as I
can so I get that taking off I'm gonna
do it again on this side I'll bring it
back and then I'm gonna use my thumb
right here and kind of break that out
until I see the socket pop out once
again I'm going to come in and free up
that always stir
I'm gonna separate the drumstick from
the thigh I'm gonna cut right here
between them there seems to be kind of a
natural seam right there I'm going to go
straight down the finite now I'm gonna
come in and going to butterfly these
thighs out a little bit I'm just gonna
simply make a cut along either side of
that bone and expose that part and
flatten that out a little bit more so
we're gonna cut along one side of that
breast bone so we start to hit the ribs
and once we hit those ribs we're just
gonna work our knife along those trying
to go as close as we can to those ribs
to get all that meat off and we're gonna
follow the wishbone which is right here
runs like that and a big feet all the
way down and then when we get to that
I'm just gonna cut right through it what
we wind up with is a bone in but
otherwise boneless breast with the
Tenderloin which is this piece right
here still attached and you can just
roast this and make it crisp
the two airline breaths the two wings
with the nice bits of back meat on the
two drumsticks two butterfly
[Music]
